docs.lead_paragraph: Brooklyn has a Board of Health which reports daily the number of cases of Cholera. Yesterday the Board opened a hospital for cholera patients. Brooklyn does well, and her great dirty brother on this side the river would do well to imitate her example. have a Board of Health,

docs.lead_paragraph: CHOLERA HOSPITAL IN BROOKLYN.--A Committee from the Board of Health, yesterday took possession of the old Jackson Homestead, situated on Lafayette-avenue, between Raymond and Navy-streets, in the Eleventh Ward, to be occupied for the treatment of cholera patients, and it is now being furnished with cots, , for that purpose.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new granite church just erected for the Unitarian Society in Jamaica Plain, Mass., was dedicated on the 15th inst. It is a beautiful edifice, furnished with a bell of over three thousand pounds weight, and an organ of unequalled tone and power.
docs.snippet: The new granite church just erected for the Unitarian Society in Jamaica Plain, Mass., was dedicated on the 15th inst. It is a beautiful edifice, furnished with a bell of over three thousand pounds weight, and an organ of unequalled tone and power.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Trial for a Divorce, COURT OF COMMON PLEAS--FRIDAY. Before Jadge Ingrabam and a Jury. FIFTH DAY..

docs.lead_paragraph: CATHARINE P. P. WALKER, BY CHRISTIAN S. SLOAN, HER NEXT FRIEND, vs. WILDES P. WALKER. The Court-room was nearly full this morning, so far as seats could be obtained, long before the hour for the resumption of the case on trial. The Jurors having answered, the Court inquired if the counsel were ready to proceed.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The Assay Office Again--The Slidell Movement--Mr. Seward's Steam Line Bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was no opportunity to-day to repair the damage which the New-York Assay Office suffered yesterday at the hands of Mr. ROBBINS, through the remissness of your City members. If the appropriation for the purchase of the Assay Office Buildings is made at all this session, it must be by amendment in the Senate; e difficulty of

byline.original: Correspondence of the New- York Daily Times

headline.main: Injury done to Cattle in Transporting them to Market.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the American Agriculturist. A Premise made some time ago, and your further late request that I would give some of my experience and observation relating to the injury done to beef cattle in driving and transporting by water or on Railroads for the New-York market, is my apology for this article.
